intro: Cylista nogalensis, commonly known as the Nogalensis Cylista, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth texture, often with a slight waxy coating. Cylista nogalensis is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats.
